duties_responsibilities.duty: Overall administration and supervision of one to four residence halls.
Supervise, train, and evaluate undergraduate and graduate Resident Assistants.
Plan and conduct weekly resident hall staff meetings and individual staff member meetings.
Manage Residence Hall budget, administer staff programming funding, and administer Resident Assistant programming.
Advise Residence Hall Councils and act as an Administrative Hearing Officer for the Bentley conduct system.
Mediate roommate conflicts and provide academic and personal counseling to students.
Oversee the operational management of the building(s) and facilitate opening and closing of the residence halls.
Coordinate regular health and safety inspections and work with the Assistant Director of Housing to ensure proper occupancy records and reports.
Serve on departmental and institutional committees, attend meetings, and act as a liaison with faculty and appropriate offices.
Assist with the implementation of institutional and departmental goals and objectives.
Coordinate specific summer projects as assigned by the Director of the Residential Center and/or Assistant Directors of the Residential Center.

education_certification.credential: Master’s degree in Higher Education Administration or related field required (graduate residence life experience preferred) or a Bachelor’s degree with 1-2 years professional residence life experience.
